title.en: Genealogical Tables of the Three Dynasties

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：五帝、三代之記，尚矣。

translations.literal: Grand Historian says: Five Emperors, Three Dynasties records, remote.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: The records of the Five Emperors and Three Dynasties are very ancient.

sentences.zh: 自殷以前諸侯不可得而譜，周以來乃頗可著。

translations.literal: From Yin before feudal lords cannot be obtained to arrange genealogy, Zhou since then considerably can be recorded.
translations.idiomatic: Before the Yin dynasty, the genealogies of the feudal lords cannot be established, but since the Zhou dynasty they have become quite recordable.

sentences.zh: 孔子因史文次春秋，紀元年，正時日月，蓋其詳哉。

translations.literal: Confucius followed historical texts arranged Spring and Autumn, recorded first year, corrected seasons days months, indeed detailed.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius followed the historical texts to arrange the Spring and Autumn Annals, recording the first year and correcting the seasons, days, and months—how detailed it is!

sentences.zh: 至於序尚書則略，無年月；

translations.literal: As for arranging Shangshu then brief, without years months;
translations.idiomatic: As for arranging the Shangshu, it is brief, without years or months;

sentences.zh: 或頗有，然多闕，不可錄。

translations.literal: Some considerably have, yet many deficient, cannot record.
translations.idiomatic: Some have quite a bit, but many are deficient and cannot be recorded.

sentences.zh: 故疑則傳疑，蓋其慎也。

translations.literal: Therefore doubt then transmit doubt, indeed cautious.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, where there is doubt, transmit the doubt—that is how cautious he was.

sentences.zh: 余讀諜記，黃帝以來皆有年數。

translations.literal: I read spy records, Yellow Emperor since all have year numbers.
translations.idiomatic: I have read the genealogical records, and from the Yellow Emperor onward they all have chronological dates.

sentences.zh: 稽其歷譜諜終始五德之傳，古文咸不同，乖異。

translations.literal: Examine their calendar genealogies spy beginning end Five Virtues transmission, ancient texts all different, divergent.
translations.idiomatic: When I examined their chronological genealogies and the transmission of the Five Virtues from beginning to end, the ancient texts are all different and contradictory.

sentences.zh: 夫子之弗論次其年月，豈虛哉！

translations.literal: Master not arranged their years months, how empty!
translations.idiomatic: The Master's not arranging their years and months—was that in vain?

sentences.zh: 於是以五帝系諜、尚書集世紀黃帝以連山訖共和為世表。

translations.literal: Thereupon used Five Emperors genealogical records, Shangshu collected century Yellow Emperor from Lianshan to Gonghe as world table.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon I used the Five Emperors' genealogical records and collected from the Shangshu to make a chronological table from the Yellow Emperor through Lianshan to Gonghe.

cells.literal: Lu Zhou Gong Dan, Wu Wang younger brother. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Lu: Zhou Gong Dan, younger brother of King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.content: 齊太公尚，文王、武王師。初封。
cells.literal: Qi Tai Gong Shang, Wen Wang, Wu Wang teacher. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Qi: Tai Gong Shang, teacher of King Wen and King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Jin Tang Shu Yu, Wu Wang son. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Jin: Tang Shu Yu, son of King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.content: 秦惡來，助紂。父飛廉，有力。
cells.literal: Qin E Lai, assisted Zhou. Father Fei Lian, had strength.
cells.idiomatic: Qin: E Lai, assisted King Zhou. Father Fei Lian, who was strong.

cells.content: 楚熊繹。繹父鬻熊，事文王。初封。
cells.literal: Chu Xiong Yi. Yi father Yu Xiong, served Wen Wang. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Chu: Xiong Yi. Yi's father Yu Xiong, who served the King Wen. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Song Wei Zi Qi, Zhou younger brother by concubine. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Song: Wei Zi Qi, younger brother of King Zhou by a concubine. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Wei Kang Shu, Wu Wang younger brother. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Wei: Kang Shu, younger brother of King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Chen Hu Gong Man, Shun's descendant. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Chen: Hu Gong Man, descendant of Shun. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Cai Shu Du, Wu Wang younger brother. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Cai: Shu Du, younger brother of King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Cao Shu Zhen Duo, Wu Wang younger brother. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Cao: Shu Zhen Duo, younger brother of King Wu. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: Yan Zhao Gong Shi, Zhou same surname. First enfeoffed.
cells.idiomatic: Yan: Zhao Gong Shi, of the same surname as Zhou. First enfeoffment.

cells.literal: King Kang Zhao punishment ceased over forty years.
cells.idiomatic: King Kang Zhao's punishments ceased for over forty years.
Wei Zhong, younger brother of Qi.

cells.content: 昭王瑕南巡不返。不赴，諱之。
cells.literal: King Zhao Xia toured south did not return. Did not attend, concealed it.
cells.idiomatic: King Zhao Xia toured south and did not return. Did not attend the funeral, concealed it.

cells.content: 穆王滿。作甫刑。荒服不至。
cells.literal: King Mu Man. Made Fu punishments. Remote regions did not come.
cells.idiomatic: King Mu Man. Made the Punishments of Fu. The remote regions did not come.

cells.literal: Duke Yang, Duke Kao younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Yang, younger brother of Duke Kao.

cells.literal: Duke Min, Duke Ding younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Min, younger brother of Duke Ding.

cells.content: 懿王堅。周道衰，詩人作刺。
cells.literal: King Yi Jian. Zhou way declined, poets made satirical poems.
cells.idiomatic: King Yi Jian. The Zhou way declined, poets made satirical poems.

cells.literal: Duke Yang, Duke Min younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Yang, younger brother of Duke Min.

cells.literal: King Xiao Fang, King Yi younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: King Xiao Fang, younger brother of King Yi.

cells.literal: King Yi Xie, King Yi son.
cells.idiomatic: King Yi Xie, son of King Yi.

cells.literal: Duke Xian, Duke Li younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Xian, younger brother of Duke Li.

cells.content: 厲王胡。以惡聞過亂，出奔，遂死於彘。
cells.literal: King Li Hu. Because hated hearing criticism caused disorder, fled, then died at Zhi.
cells.idiomatic: King Li Hu. Because he hated hearing the criticism and caused disorder, he fled and died at Zhi.
Xiong Yan, younger brother of Hong.
Gonghe, the two nobles administered government.

cells.literal: Duke Wu, Duke Zhen younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: Duke Wu, younger brother of Duke Zhen.

sentences.zh: 張夫子問褚先生曰：「詩言契、后稷皆無父而生。

translations.literal: Master Zhang asked Master Chu said: "Poetry says Qi, Hou Ji both without father born.
translations.idiomatic: Master Zhang asked Master Chu: "The Poetry says that Qi and Hou Ji were both born without fathers.

sentences.zh: 今案諸傳記咸言有父，父皆黃帝子也，得無與詩謬秋？」

translations.literal: Now examine various biographies all say had fathers, fathers all Yellow Emperor sons, could it contradict Poetry?
translations.idiomatic: Now when I examine the various biographies they all say they had fathers, and their fathers were all sons of the Yellow Emperor. Could it be that this contradicts the Poetry?

sentences.zh: 褚先生曰：「不然。

translations.literal: Master Chu said: "Not so.
translations.idiomatic: Master Chu said: "Not so.

sentences.zh: 詩言契生於卵，后稷人跡者，欲見其有天命精誠之意耳。

translations.literal: Poetry says Qi born from egg, Hou Ji human footprints, wished show had heaven mandate sincere intentions.
translations.idiomatic: The Poetry says that Qi was born from an egg, and Hou Ji from human footprints, to show that they had the mandate of heaven and sincere intentions.

sentences.zh: 鬼神不能自成，須人而生，柰何無父而生乎！

translations.literal: Spirits gods cannot form themselves, must through humans born, how could without father born!
translations.idiomatic: Spirits and gods cannot form themselves, they must be born through the humans. How could they be born without fathers?

sentences.zh: 一言有父，一言無父，信以傳信，疑以傳疑，故兩言之。

translations.literal: One account has father, one account no father, trustworthy transmit trustworthy, doubtful transmit doubtful, therefore both speak of it.
translations.idiomatic: One account says they had fathers, one account says they had no fathers. Transmit what is trustworthy as trustworthy, transmit what is doubtful as doubtful, therefore the accounts are given.

sentences.zh: 堯知契、稷皆賢人，天之所生，故封之契七十里，後十餘世至湯，王天下。

translations.literal: Yao knew Qi, Ji both worthy men, heaven's born, therefore enfeoffed Qi seventy li, after ten remaining generations reached Tang, king world.
translations.idiomatic: Yao knew that Qi and Ji were both worthy men, born of heaven, therefore he enfeoffed Qi with seventy li. After more than ten generations they reached Tang, who became king of the world.

sentences.zh: 堯知后稷子孫之後王也，故益封之百里，其後世且千歲，至文王而有天下。

translations.literal: Yao knew Hou Ji descendants later kings, therefore additionally enfeoffed him hundred li, his descendants nearly thousand years, reached Wen Wang obtained world.
translations.idiomatic: Yao knew that Hou Ji's descendants would later become kings, therefore he additionally enfeoffed him with a hundred li. His descendants lasted nearly a thousand years, until Wen Wang obtained the world.

sentences.zh: 詩傳曰：『湯之先為契，無父而生。

translations.literal: Poetry commentary says: "Tang's ancestor was Qi, without father born.
translations.idiomatic: The Poetry Commentary says: "Tang's ancestor was Qi, born without a father.

sentences.zh: 契母與姊妹浴於玄丘水，有燕銜卵墮之，契母得，故含之，誤吞之，即生契。

translations.literal: Qi mother with sisters bathed Xuanhou water, swallow carried egg dropped it, Qi mother obtained, therefore held in mouth, mistakenly swallowed, then gave birth Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Qi's mother and her sisters were bathing in the Xuanhou River, when a swallow carried an egg and dropped it. Qi's mother obtained it, so she held it in her mouth, mistakenly swallowed it, and then gave birth to Qi.

sentences.zh: 契生而賢，堯立為司徒，姓之曰子氏。

translations.literal: Qi born wise, Yao established as Minister of Rites, surnamed him Zi clan.
translations.idiomatic: Qi was born wise, Yao established him as Minister of Rites, and gave him the surname Zi.

sentences.zh: 子者茲；

translations.literal: Zi means increase;
translations.idiomatic: Zi means increase;

sentences.zh: 茲，益大也。

translations.literal: Increase, benefit great.
translations.idiomatic: Increase means to become greater.

sentences.zh: 詩人美而頌之曰「殷社芒芒，天命玄鳥，降而生商」。

translations.literal: Poets praised celebrated it said "Yin altar vast, heaven mandate dark bird, descended gave birth Shang."
translations.idiomatic: The poets praised and celebrated it saying "The Yin altar is vast, the heavenly mandate is the dark bird, descended and gave birth to Shang."

sentences.zh: 商者質，殷號也。

translations.literal: Shang means solid, Yin designation.
translations.idiomatic: Shang means solid, it is the designation of Yin.

sentences.zh: 文王之先為后稷，后稷亦無父而生。

translations.literal: Wen Wang's ancestor was Hou Ji, Hou Ji also without father born.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Wang's ancestor was Hou Ji, Hou Ji was also born without a father.

sentences.zh: 后稷母為姜嫄，出見大人蹟而履踐之，知於身，則生后稷。

translations.literal: Hou Ji mother was Jiang Yuan, went out saw giant footprints stepped on them, knew in body, then gave birth Hou Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Hou Ji's mother was Jiang Yuan. She went out and saw the giant footprints and stepped on them. She knew it in her body, then gave birth to Hou Ji.

sentences.zh: 姜嫄以為無父，賤而棄之道中，牛羊避不踐也。

translations.literal: Jiang Yuan thought no father, despised abandoned in road, oxen sheep avoided not tread.
translations.idiomatic: Jiang Yuan thought he had no father, so she despised him and abandoned him in the road. Oxen and sheep avoided him and did not tread on him.

sentences.zh: 抱之山中，山者養之。

translations.literal: Carried him mountain middle, mountain spirits raised him.
translations.idiomatic: She carried him to the mountains, and the mountain spirits raised him.

sentences.zh: 又捐之大澤，鳥覆席食之。

translations.literal: Again cast him great marsh, birds covered wings fed him.
translations.idiomatic: Again she cast him into the great marsh, birds covered him with their wings and fed him.

sentences.zh: 姜嫄怪之，於是知其天子，乃取長之。

translations.literal: Jiang Yuan amazed by it, so knew he son of heaven, then took raised him.
translations.idiomatic: Jiang Yuan was amazed by this, so she knew he was a son of heaven, and took him to raise.

sentences.zh: 堯知其賢才，立以為大農，姓之曰姬氏。

translations.literal: Yao knew his worthy talents, established as Great Farmer, surnamed him Ji clan.
translations.idiomatic: Yao knew his worthy talents, established him as Great Farmer, and gave him the surname Ji.

sentences.zh: 姬者，本也。

translations.literal: Ji means root.
translations.idiomatic: Ji means root.

sentences.zh: 詩人美而頌之曰「厥初生民」，深修益成，而道后稷之始也。』

translations.literal: Poets praised celebrated it said "in beginning gave birth people", profoundly cultivated increased success, showed Hou Ji origins."
translations.idiomatic: The poets praised and celebrated it saying "In the beginning he gave birth to the people", profoundly cultivating and increasing success, to show Hou Ji's origins."

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：『昔者堯命契為子氏，為有湯也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Former times Yao commanded Qi to be Zi clan, because would have Tang.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: "In former times Yao commanded Qi to be of the Zi clan, because there would be Tang.

sentences.zh: 命后稷為姬氏，為有文王也。

translations.literal: Commanded Hou Ji to be Ji clan, because would have Wen Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Commanded Hou Ji to be of the Ji clan, because there would be Wen Wang.

sentences.zh: 大王命季歷，明天瑞也。

translations.literal: Great King commanded Ji Li, illuminate heavenly omens.
translations.idiomatic: Great King commanded Ji Li, to illuminate the heavenly omens.

sentences.zh: 太伯之吳，遂生源也。』

translations.literal: Tai Bo went Wu, then originated source."
translations.idiomatic: Tai Bo went to Wu, and thus originated the source."

sentences.zh: 天命難言，非聖人莫能見。

translations.literal: Heavenly mandate difficult speak, only sages can see.
translations.idiomatic: The heavenly mandate is difficult to speak of, only sages can see it.

sentences.zh: 舜、禹、契、后稷皆黃帝子孫也。

translations.literal: Shun, Yu, Qi, Hou Ji all Yellow Emperor descendants.
translations.idiomatic: Shun, Yu, Qi, and Hou Ji were all descendants of the Yellow Emperor.

sentences.zh: 黃帝策天命而治天下，德澤深後世，故其子孫皆復立為天子，是天之報有德也。

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor grasped heavenly mandate governed world, virtue grace deep benefited later generations, therefore descendants all again established as sons of heaven, this heaven's reward for virtue.
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor grasped the heavenly mandate and governed the world, his virtue and grace deeply benefited later generations, therefore his descendants all again became established as sons of heaven—this is heaven's reward for virtue.

sentences.zh: 人不知，以為閒從布衣匹夫起耳。

translations.literal: People not know, think by chance from commoners ordinary men arose.
translations.idiomatic: People do not know this, and think they arose from commoners and ordinary men by chance.

sentences.zh: 夫布衣匹夫安能無故而起王天下乎？

translations.literal: Commoners ordinary men how could without cause arise king world?
translations.idiomatic: How could commoners and ordinary men arise without cause to become kings of the world?

sentences.zh: 其有天命然。」

translations.literal: They had heavenly mandate thus."
translations.idiomatic: It is because they had the heavenly mandate."

sentences.zh: 「黃帝後世何王天下之久遠邪？」

translations.literal: "Yellow Emperor descendants why king world so long?"
translations.idiomatic: "Why did the Yellow Emperor's descendants rule the world so long?"

sentences.zh: 曰：「傳云天下之君王為萬夫之黔首請贖民之命者帝，有福萬世。

translations.literal: Said: "Traditions say world ruler for ten thousand men common people redeemed people's lives became emperor, had good fortune ten thousand generations.
translations.idiomatic: He said: "The traditions say that the ruler of the world who redeemed the lives of the common people for ten thousand men became emperor, and had good fortune for ten thousand generations.

sentences.zh: 黃帝是也。

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor was such.
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor was such a one.

sentences.zh: 五政明則修禮義，因天時舉兵征伐而利者王，有福千世。

translations.literal: Five administrations clear then cultivated rites righteousness, followed heavenly times raised troops campaigned profited became kings, had good fortune thousand generations.
translations.idiomatic: When the five administrations were clear then he cultivated rites and righteousness, raised troops to campaign at the right heavenly times and those who profited became kings, having good fortune for a thousand generations.

sentences.zh: 蜀王，黃帝後世也，至今在漢西南五千里，常來朝降，輸獻於漢，非以其先之有德，澤流後世邪？

translations.literal: Shu King, Yellow Emperor descendant, even now in Han southwest five thousand li, regularly comes courts submits, offers tribute to Han, not because ancestors had virtue, grace flowed later generations?
translations.idiomatic: The King of Shu was also a descendant of the Yellow Emperor. Even now he is five thousand li southwest of Han, and regularly comes to court and submit, offering tribute to Han. Is this not because his ancestors had virtue, and their grace flowed to later generations?

sentences.zh: 行道德豈可以忽秋哉！

translations.literal: Practice morality virtue how can neglect!
translations.idiomatic: Practicing morality and virtue—how can it be neglected!

sentences.zh: 人君王者舉而觀之。

translations.literal: Ruler kings take up observe it.
translations.idiomatic: Rulers and kings should take this up and observe it.

sentences.zh: 漢大將軍霍子孟名光者，亦黃帝後世也。

translations.literal: Han Grand General Huo Zimen named Guang, also Yellow Emperor descendant.
translations.idiomatic: The Han Grand General Huo Zimen named Guang was also a descendant of the Yellow Emperor.

sentences.zh: 此可為博聞遠見者言，固難為淺聞者說也。

translations.literal: This can speak to broad learning far sight people, certainly difficult explain to shallow knowledge people.
translations.idiomatic: This can be spoken of to those with the broad learning and far sight, but it is certainly difficult to explain to those with the shallow knowledge.

sentences.zh: 何以言之？

translations.literal: Why speak thus?
translations.idiomatic: Why do I say this?

sentences.zh: 古諸侯以國為姓。

translations.literal: Ancient feudal lords took state as surname.
translations.idiomatic: In ancient times the feudal lords took their state as surname.

sentences.zh: 霍者，國名也。

translations.literal: Huo, state name.
translations.idiomatic: Huo was a state name.

sentences.zh: 武王封弟叔處於霍，後世晉獻公滅霍公，後世為庶民，往來居平陽。

translations.literal: Wu Wang enfeoffed younger brother Shu Chu at Huo, later generations Jin Xian Gong extinguished Huo Gong, later generations became commoners, coming going resided Pingyang.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu enfeoffed his younger brother Shu Chu at Huo. The later generations, Duke Xian of Jin extinguished Duke Huo, and the later generations became commoners, coming and going and residing at Pingyang.

sentences.zh: 平陽在河東，河東晉地，分為衛國。

translations.literal: Pingyang in Hedong, Hedong Jin territory, divided became Wei state.
translations.idiomatic: Pingyang is in Hedong, Hedong is the Jin territory, divided to become the Wei state.

sentences.zh: 以詩言之，亦可為周世。

translations.literal: In terms Poetry speak, also can consider Zhou era.
translations.idiomatic: Speaking in terms of the Poetry, it can also be considered the Zhou era.

sentences.zh: 周起后稷，后稷無父而生。

translations.literal: Zhou arose from Hou Ji, Hou Ji without father born.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou arose from Hou Ji, Hou Ji was born without a father.

sentences.zh: 以三代世傳言之，后稷有父名高辛；

translations.literal: In terms three dynasties generational transmissions speak, Hou Ji had father named Gao Xin;
translations.idiomatic: Speaking in terms of the three dynasties' generational transmissions, Hou Ji had a father named Gao Xin;

sentences.zh: 高辛，黃帝曾孫。

translations.literal: Gao Xin, Yellow Emperor great-grandson.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Xin was the great-grandson of the Yellow Emperor.

sentences.zh: 黃帝終始傳曰：『漢興百有餘年，有人不短不長，出（自）［白］燕之鄉，持天下之政，時有嬰兒主，欲行車。』

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor beginning end chronicles say: "Han arose hundred remaining years, there is man neither short nor tall, comes Bai Yan region, holds world government, time has infant ruler, desires travel carriage."
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor's Chronicles of Beginning and End say: "Over a hundred years after the Han arose, there will be a man neither short nor tall, coming from the region of Bai Yan, holding the government of the world, at a time when there is an infant ruler, desiring to travel by carriage."

sentences.zh: 霍將軍者，本居平陽（自）［白］燕。

translations.literal: Huo General, originally resided Pingyang Bai Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The General Huo was originally from Pingyang in Bai Yan.

sentences.zh: 臣為郎時，與方士考功會旗亭下，為臣言。

translations.literal: When I gentleman attendant, met alchemist Kao Gong under banner pavilion, spoke to me.
translations.idiomatic: When I was a gentleman attendant, I met with the alchemist Kao Gong under the banner pavilion, and he spoke to me.

sentences.zh: 豈不偉哉！」

translations.literal: How not magnificent!"
translations.idiomatic: Is this not magnificent!"
